trans-unit.source: How to use Blitline for image processing - Azure feature guide
trans-unit.target: How to use Blitline for image processing - Azure feature guide

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Blitline service to process images within an Azure application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Blitline service to process images within an Azure application.

trans-unit.source: How to use Blitline with Azure and Azure Storage
trans-unit.target: How to use Blitline with Azure and Azure Storage

trans-unit.source: This guide will explain how to access Blitline services and how to submit jobs to Blitline.
trans-unit.target: This guide will explain how to access Blitline services and how to submit jobs to Blitline.

trans-unit.source: What is Blitline?
trans-unit.target: What is Blitline?

trans-unit.source: Blitline is a cloud-based image processing service that provides enterprise level image processing at a fraction of the price that it would cost to build it yourself.
trans-unit.target: Blitline is a cloud-based image processing service that provides enterprise level image processing at a fraction of the price that it would cost to build it yourself.

trans-unit.source: The fact is that image processing has been done over and over again, usually rebuilt from the ground up for each and every website.
trans-unit.target: The fact is that image processing has been done over and over again, usually rebuilt from the ground up for each and every website.

trans-unit.source: We realize this because we’ve built them a million times too.
trans-unit.target: We realize this because we’ve built them a million times too.

trans-unit.source: One day we decided that perhaps it‘s time we just do it for everyone.
trans-unit.target: One day we decided that perhaps it‘s time we just do it for everyone.

trans-unit.source: We know how to do it, to do it fast and efficiently, and save everyone work in the meantime.
trans-unit.target: We know how to do it, to do it fast and efficiently, and save everyone work in the meantime.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [http://www.blitline.com](http://www.blitline.com).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [http://www.blitline.com](http://www.blitline.com).

trans-unit.source: What Blitline is NOT...
trans-unit.target: What Blitline is NOT...

trans-unit.source: To clarify what Blitline is useful for, it is often easier to identify what Blitline does NOT do before moving forward.
trans-unit.target: To clarify what Blitline is useful for, it is often easier to identify what Blitline does NOT do before moving forward.

trans-unit.source: Blitline does NOT have HTML widgets to upload images.
trans-unit.target: Blitline does NOT have HTML widgets to upload images.

trans-unit.source: You must have images available publicly or with restricted permissions available for Blitline to reach.
trans-unit.target: You must have images available publicly or with restricted permissions available for Blitline to reach.

trans-unit.source: Blitline does NOT do live image processing, like Aviary.com
trans-unit.target: Blitline does NOT do live image processing, like Aviary.com

trans-unit.source: Blitline does NOT accept image uploads, you cannot push your images to Blitline directly.
trans-unit.target: Blitline does NOT accept image uploads, you cannot push your images to Blitline directly.

trans-unit.source: You must push them to Azure Storage or other places Blitline supports and then tell Blitline where to go get them.
trans-unit.target: You must push them to Azure Storage or other places Blitline supports and then tell Blitline where to go get them.

trans-unit.source: Blitline is massively parallel and does NOT do any synchronous processing.
trans-unit.target: Blitline is massively parallel and does NOT do any synchronous processing.

trans-unit.source: Meaning you must give us a postback_url and we can tell you when we are done processing.
trans-unit.target: Meaning you must give us a postback_url and we can tell you when we are done processing.

trans-unit.source: Create a Blitline account
trans-unit.target: Create a Blitline account

trans-unit.source: How to create a Blitline job
trans-unit.target: How to create a Blitline job

trans-unit.source: Blitline uses JSON to define the actions you want to take on an image.
trans-unit.target: Blitline uses JSON to define the actions you want to take on an image.

trans-unit.source: This JSON is composed of a few simple fields.
trans-unit.target: This JSON is composed of a few simple fields.

trans-unit.source: The simplest example is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The simplest example is as follows:

trans-unit.source: Here we have JSON that will take a "src" image "...boys.jpeg" and then resize that image to 240x140.
trans-unit.target: Here we have JSON that will take a "src" image "...boys.jpeg" and then resize that image to 240x140.

trans-unit.source: The Application ID is something you can find in your **CONNECTION INFO** or **MANAGE** tab on Azure.
trans-unit.target: The Application ID is something you can find in your **CONNECTION INFO** or **MANAGE** tab on Azure.

trans-unit.source: It is your secret identifier that allows you to run jobs on Blitline.
trans-unit.target: It is your secret identifier that allows you to run jobs on Blitline.

trans-unit.source: The "save" parameter identifies information about where you want to put the image once we have processed it.
trans-unit.target: The "save" parameter identifies information about where you want to put the image once we have processed it.

trans-unit.source: In this trivial case, we haven't defined one.
trans-unit.target: In this trivial case, we haven't defined one.

trans-unit.source: If no location is defined Blitline will store it locally (and temporarily) at a unique cloud location.
trans-unit.target: If no location is defined Blitline will store it locally (and temporarily) at a unique cloud location.

trans-unit.source: You will be able to get that location from the JSON returned by Blitline when you make the Blitline.
trans-unit.target: You will be able to get that location from the JSON returned by Blitline when you make the Blitline.

trans-unit.source: The "image" identifier is required and is returned to you when to identify this particular saved image.
trans-unit.target: The "image" identifier is required and is returned to you when to identify this particular saved image.

trans-unit.source: You can find more information about the *functions* we support here: <http://www.blitline.com/docs/functions>
trans-unit.target: You can find more information about the *functions* we support here: <http://www.blitline.com/docs/functions>

trans-unit.source: You can also find documentation about the job options here: <http://www.blitline.com/docs/api>
trans-unit.target: You can also find documentation about the job options here: <http://www.blitline.com/docs/api>

trans-unit.source: Once you have your JSON all you need to do is **POST** it to `http://api.blitline.com/jobs`
trans-unit.target: Once you have your JSON all you need to do is **POST** it to `http://api.blitline.com/jobs`

trans-unit.source: You will get JSON back that looks something like this:
trans-unit.target: You will get JSON back that looks something like this:

trans-unit.source: This tells you that Blitline has recieved your request, it has put it in a processing queue, and when it has completed the image will be available at:
trans-unit.target: This tells you that Blitline has recieved your request, it has put it in a processing queue, and when it has completed the image will be available at:

trans-unit.source: **https://s3.amazonaws.com/dev.blitline/2011110722/YOUR\_APP\_ID/CK3f0xBF_2bV6wf7gEZE8w.jpg**
trans-unit.target: **https://s3.amazonaws.com/dev.blitline/2011110722/YOUR\_APP\_ID/CK3f0xBF_2bV6wf7gEZE8w.jpg**

trans-unit.source: How to save an image to your Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: How to save an image to your Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: If you have an Azure Storage account, you can easily have Blitline push the processed images into your Azure container.
trans-unit.target: If you have an Azure Storage account, you can easily have Blitline push the processed images into your Azure container.

trans-unit.source: By adding an "azure_destination" you define the location and permissions for Blitline to push to.
trans-unit.target: By adding an "azure_destination" you define the location and permissions for Blitline to push to.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example:

trans-unit.source: By filling in the CAPITALIZED values with your own, you can submit this JSON to http://api.blitline.com/job and the "src" image will be processed with a blur filter and then pushed to you Azure destination.
trans-unit.target: By filling in the CAPITALIZED values with your own, you can submit this JSON to http://api.blitline.com/job and the "src" image will be processed with a blur filter and then pushed to you Azure destination.

trans-unit.source: Please note:
trans-unit.target: Please note:

trans-unit.source: The SAS must contain the entire SAS url, including the filename of the destination file.
trans-unit.target: The SAS must contain the entire SAS url, including the filename of the destination file.

trans-unit.target: Example:

trans-unit.target: You can also read the latest edition of Blitline's Azure Storage docs [here](http://www.blitline.com/docs/azure_storage).
